Commit:b22ed4c0d6592f2646d63aaeeb94426e9b02a2b6
Time:2008-08-25 18:11:07 +0000
Author:RossPatterson
E-Mail:RossPatterson@8a0e9b86-a613-0410-befa-817088176213
Message:CCNET-639 Multiple Sourcecontrol with more than one Subversion or AccuRev sub-sourcecontrols may attempt to update the source to the wrong revision number because they use a shared LastChangeNumber. The fix is to have them remember what modifications they contributed to the overall set, and to compute the update-target change number only against that subset.

Commit:c8966c57c485d275af61c418e7db53c23e7f4e7f
Time:2008-01-02 12:56:41 +0000
Author:davcamer
E-Mail:davcamer@8a0e9b86-a613-0410-befa-817088176213
Message:CCNET-887: Hopeful fix for the overcaching. Stopped rendering the NOT_AVAILABLE fingerprint to the response headers. It appears this was leading to endless caching, because the client and server both agreed that the only fingerprint for the content was the NOT_AVAILABLE fingerprint.

This fix is less aggressive than what I was doing at first: it may still be possible for clients to send bad request headers such that they get a NotModified response when they shouldn't, but that's their fault. NOT_AVAILABLE should not be equal to itself anyway, and behaves that way in unit tests, so I'm not clear EXACTLY what was happening.

git-svn-id: https://ccnet.svn.sourceforge.net/svnroot/ccnet/trunk@3583 8a0e9b86-a613-0410-befa-817088176213

Commit:fd3653e3736deef74dc636e845cb9594563e75c4
Time:2007-12-06 22:56:35 +0000
Author:RossPatterson
E-Mail:RossPatterson@8a0e9b86-a613-0410-befa-817088176213
Message:CCNET-179: Add ExternalSourceControl source control provider.

Configuration:
    <sourcecontrol type="external"> 
        <executable>(path to command-line application)</executable> 
        <args>(command-line parameters for application</args> 
        <autoGetSource>(true/false like other sourcecontrol providers)</autoGetSource> 
        <labelOnSuccess>(true/false like other sourcecontrol providers)</labelOnSuccess> 
        <environment> 
            <var>name=value</var> (environment variables to pass to the provider) 
            <var>name=value</var> 
        </environment> 
    </sourcecontrol> 

Each of the three sourcecontrol operations (GetModifications(), GetSource(), and LabelSourceControl()) are exposed to the provider as commands: 

    executable GETMODS "fromtimestamp" "totimestamp" args_value 
    executable GETSOURCE "workingdirectory" "timestamp" args_value 
    executable SETLABEL "label" "sourcetimestamp" args_value 

The decision about whether changes exist or not and what they are is up to the provider and is expressed as a list of modifications in the XML format used by <modificationWriter>.

git-svn-id: https://ccnet.svn.sourceforge.net/svnroot/ccnet/trunk@3540 8a0e9b86-a613-0410-befa-817088176213

A	project/core/sourcecontrol/ExternalSourceControlHistoryParser.cs

Commit:7d241f3ef5494c26a191fd4c1634f7e04b806c10
Time:2007-11-20 20:26:58 +0000
Author:RossPatterson
E-Mail:RossPatterson@8a0e9b86-a613-0410-befa-817088176213
Message:CCNET-918 PlasticSCM source control support.  Implement notes from Jira: 1) The <workingDirectory> parameter is currently required. In several other source control implementations, it is optional, defaulting to the project working directory. Those implementations also make any relative paths relative to the project working directory.

2) Some of the source control implementations implement <autoGetSource>true|false</autoGetSource>, defaulting to true, and making the GetSource() method conditional on on its being true.

Commit:5b6caa80da9326d37c6321024f6f3127cb570119
Time:2007-11-20 13:33:43 +0000
Author:davcamer

Time:2007-11-09 16:07:32 +0000
Author:RossPatterson
E-Mail:RossPatterson@8a0e9b86-a613-0410-befa-817088176213
Message:CCNET-1019: DevEnv task misinterprets spaces in project path

The <devenv> task has been changed to enquote the solution file name, the configuration name, and the project name.  Since some people may have been working around this by enquoting them in the CCNet configuration, the fix is conditional - it doesn't add quotes if the value starts with a quote.

Commit:63e72b9520c4a9f5b6c5574419e0129a7e425372
Time:2006-12-03 06:29:20 +0000
Author:exortech
E-Mail:exortech@8a0e9b86-a613-0410-befa-817088176213
Message:fixing root cause of sporadic abnormal timeouts from RunnablePorcess.  this was due to the fact that i) the ManualResetEvent was not being disposed and ii) the Process.Exited event was firing asynchronously from the ThreadPool.  the combination of these two factors were causing the latch to be set unexpectedly.  this has now (hopefully) been resolved.

git-svn-id: https://ccnet.svn.sourceforge.net/svnroot/ccnet/trunk@2737 8a0e9b86-a613-0410-befa-817088176213

Commit:02a9f1e817cd30290db386e9acf1386fafec9d1a
Time:2006-02-15 17:28:28 +0000
Author:ianolsen
E-Mail:ianolsen@8a0e9b86-a613-0410-befa-817088176213
Message:Fixes for the following bugs:

CCNET-613: failure to label isn't handled correctly
CCNET-614: useWorkingFolder with label isn't handled correctly
CCNET-615: adds and deletes aren't correctly parsed when checking mods, so you can't filter them
CCNET-616: logging is confusing when using multiple source control blocks
CCNET-617: "checkin" for date/time on retrieved files is hard-coded
CCNET-618: can't empty source folder before retrieval
CCNET-638: support for HTTP proxies

Lots of new unit tests to more thoroughly test the possible options.

For those using Vault 3.1.7 or newer, the following fixes also apply:

1) Solved server contention issues with multiple simultaneous logins when CC.NET starts several projects
2) Significantly faster change polling
3) Significantly faster source retrieval, compared to the 1.0 release with labeling enabled
4) The label, get source, remove label hack is no longer necessary.  We now retrieve and label a specific version of the source tree, making the entire integration significantly simpler and faster.

Commit:d245cd32acb702c81d8dd0b592a836233f5f2284
Time:2005-11-16 19:55:25 +0000
Author:mikeroberts
E-Mail:mikeroberts@8a0e9b86-a613-0410-befa-817088176213
Message:CCNET-553 - Use more friendly URLs in Dashboard. We are now using REST style URLs, eg: http://host/ccnet/server/myServer/project/myProject/build/myBuild, rather than specifiying server, project and build as url params. For this to work, some of the templates and stylesheets need updating since we are no longer using a flat directory structure. Stylesheets should now reference the applicationPath xsl:param that is now set (see one of the changed xslt files as an example) Still a bit more work before the issue is complete

Commit:0817078e53ee8bbd2f0e48deb7d66d179f92f9a2
Time:2005-03-16 07:22:07 +0000
Author:jrw1975
E-Mail:jrw1975@8a0e9b86-a613-0410-befa-817088176213
Message:Creation and remove of the Web Dashboard virtual directory is now handled by the install/uninstall process. The following caveats are in effect:

1. The name of the vdir is always 'ccnet'. If a user installs CC.NET with the vdir, subsequently renames the vdir to something else, creates a new vdir with the name 'ccnet', and uninstalls CC.NET; the NEW ccnet vdir will be removed. Am considering storing a GUID of the created vdir into the registry during the installation process.
2. Only the default website is used by the installer.

Commit:ef098147240255c8cfbe55d6e31ee432afc8f96b
Time:2004-11-15 05:18:47 +0000
Author:exortech
E-Mail:exortech@8a0e9b86-a613-0410-befa-817088176213
Message:enhancements for 214: the underlying problem was actually due to changes to the XmlIntegrationResultWriter (i switched it to use an XmlTextReader instead of an XmlValidatingReader).  i've fixed that and also refactored the code out into an XmlFragmentWriter. i also added the --nologo arg to the NAnt call so that the non-xml header will not be produce. with these fixes the stripping the start of the NAnt output is not necessary.

fix will go into build 584.

Commit:5ecb634af8386c350606d4d2af7a18fe8a0b4924
Time:2004-05-28 17:40:58 +0000
Author:joachim_chapman
E-Mail:joachim_chapman@8a0e9b86-a613-0410-befa-817088176213
Message:Fixes to resolve CCNET-45.

Problem was that the server could not show help if the configuration file was not valid/available.

So I've changed the configuration loading so the configs are lazily loaded as required.  This way the server can start-up and show help even if the configuration is invalid.

blocking thread, and wait(timeout) method never reached)

4) Renamed Configuration namespace to Config (avoid name collision)

delete folder created in previous test)

Commit:793aa396017d8f3e2b1100637ca84f8d13cbeccb
Time:2003-10-01 09:07:52 +0000
Author:drewnoakes
E-Mail:drewnoakes@8a0e9b86-a613-0410-befa-817088176213
Message:Refactored scheduling code to allow remote forcing of the build while server is sleeping.  The integrator thread no longer goes to sleep -- rather it polls the schedule to see whether it should run.  The schedule facilitates this sleeping by tracking the required duration.  Updates to the Xsd -- the configuration file now requires sleepSeconds on the <schedule/> element, rather than on the project.  I'll update the documentation soon.  Various other code tidying & lots more inline documentation.

Message:Addressed NullReferenceException caused during Page_Load where BodyLabel WebControl hadn't been initialised.  The exception catch block attempted to use it to display the error message, which caused the NullReferenceException, and lost the original exception.  Now, if the BodyLabel is null, the original exception is re-thrown.

Access user settings by right-clicking the tray icon.  New ResourceUtil class is used to access embedded resources.  New Audio class is used to play audio.

Commit:9f03ce02de85e788c89191f66a14ea334069d721
Time:2003-09-11 16:15:23 +0000
Author:drewnoakes
E-Mail:drewnoakes@8a0e9b86-a613-0410-befa-817088176213
Message:Major refactor of cctray, and addition of new features.  Balloon popups display after each build.  Client-side remoting and monitoring code extracted to new component class (StatusMonitor).  Namespaces adjusted to be inline with the predominant ccnet naming standard.  Transitions between build states modelled using new enumeration (i.e. StillSuccessful, StillFailing, Broken, Fixed).  Web page can be launched from context menu, or by double clicking the tray icon (provided URL is specified in project configuration file).  Icon removed from ALT+TAB popup dialog, ensuring form is alway invisible.
